CLAUSE TWELFTH  PENAL PECUNIARY CLAUSE

    12.1 In case of failing to fulfill the obligations of the SENDER as a result of any actions or illegal omissions or deviations from the Contract, the  SENDER agrees to pay ECOPETROL as a penalty, an amount equivalent to ten percent (10%) of the final value of the Contract.

    12.2 Said sum shall be charged to the amount of damage suffered by ECOPETROL, and its value may be taken directly from the balance in favor of  the SENDER if there is any, or else from the Bond. If this is not possible, the penal pecuniary clause shall be collected by means of execution for  which the Contract shall be a writ of execution.

    12.3 The application of the penal pecuniary clause does not include the indemnification for any damages borne by the SENDER if the amounts of  these are higher, under the criteria of ECOPETROL, to the amount of the penal pecuniary clause agreed hereof, nor it releases the SENDER from its  payment obligation of the totality of the value of the Contract pursuant to the conditions agreed.
perturbation.changed_text:
CLAUSE TWELFTH  PENAL PECUNIARY CLAUSE

    12.1 In case of failing to fulfill the obligations of the SENDER as a result of any actions or illegal omissions or deviations from the Contract, the  SENDER agrees to pay ECOPETROL a penalty. The specific amount for the penalties is established in the Manual of the Shipper (Annex 1).

    12.2 Said sum shall be charged to the amount of damage suffered by ECOPETROL, and its value may be taken directly from the balance in favor of  the SENDER if there is any, or else from the Bond. If this is not possible, the penal pecuniary clause shall be collected by means of execution for  which the Contract shall be a writ of execution.

    12.3 The application of the penal pecuniary clause does not include the indemnification for any damages borne by the SENDER if the amounts of  these are higher, under the criteria of ECOPETROL, to the amount of the penal pecuniary clause agreed hereof, nor it releases the SENDER from its  payment obligation of the totality of the value of the Contract pursuant to the conditions agreed.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract defines the penalty as 10% of the final contract value. The revised clause refers to Annex 1 (Manual of the Shipper) for the amount. However, the Manual of the Shipper does not specify the penalty amount, creating a contradiction. This makes enforcement uncertain because the contract references a specific amount (removed) and directs the reader to another document where the amount is not specified.

perturbation.original_text: 2.1.68 Transportation Rate or Rate: means the monetary value per barrel charged by the Transporter to the Senders for the Transportation service.  Surcharges, bonuses and discounts shall be applied to this rate as specified in the monetary conditions.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.1.68 Transportation Rate or Rate: means the monetary value per barrel charged by the Transporter to the Senders for the Transportation service. Surcharges, bonuses and discounts may be applied to this rate.
perturbation.explanation: The key contractual term 'Surcharges, bonuses and discounts' has a very ambiguous modification. By using the word 'may', uncertainty is introduced. The original language has been weakened, but the exact implications are unclear. This will affect the fees and payment clause.

perturbation.changed_text:
26.2 The following documents may be an integral part of the Contract:





ANNEX 1 MANUAL OF THE SHIPPER OF THE ECOPETROL S A PIPELINE

ANNEX 2 GUIDELINES FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF RECEIVABLE SERVICES OF ECOPETROL

ANNEX 3 GENERAL CLAUSES OF ECOPETROL FOR PERFORMANCE POLICIES

perturbation.explanation: This creates ambiguity regarding which documents constitute the contract. By changing 'are' to 'may be', the parties can argue about whether certain annexes are legally binding, impacting enforceability of sections referencing those annexes. The essential terms (Annexes) may not be fully agreed upon now.
